algorithmic limitations, we identify a fundamental, pervasive data-level
driver: typicality bias in preference data, whereby annotators systematically
favor familiar text as a result of well-established findings in cognitive
psychology. We formalize this bias theoretically, verify it on preference
datasets empirically, and show that it plays a central role in mode collapse.
Motivated by this analysis, we introduce Verbalized Sampling, a simple,
training-free prompting strategy to circumvent mode collapse. VS prompts the
model to verbalize a probability distribution over a set of responses (e.g.,
``Generate 5 jokes about coffee and their corresponding probabilities'').
Comprehensive experiments show that VS significantly improves performance
across creative writing (poems, stories, jokes), dialogue simulation,
open-ended QA, and synthetic data generation, without sacrificing factual
accuracy and safety. For instance, in creative writing, VS increases diversity
by 1.6-2.1x over direct prompting. We further observe an emergent trend that
more capable models benefit more from VS. In sum, our work provides a new
data-centric perspective on mode collapse and a practical inference-time remedy
that helps unlock pre-trained generative diversity.

</details>


### [154] [Energy-Regularized Sequential Model Editing on Hyperspheres](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.01172)
*Qingyuan Liu,Jia-Chen Gu,Yunzhi Yao,Hong Wang,Nanyun Peng*

Main category: cs.CL

TL;DR: LLM模型编辑易导致灾难性遗忘，为解决此问题，提出SPHERE方法，通过保持神经元权重在超球上的均匀分布来提高稳定性，实验证明SPHERE在保持模型原有性能的同时，提升了16.41%的编辑能力。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 大型语言模型（LLMs）需要不断更新以跟上现实世界的知识变迁，但模型编辑方法（Model editing）相比于重新训练是一种更轻量级的选择。然而，顺序编辑（sequential editing）常常导致模型表示不稳定并引发灾难性遗忘（catastrophic forgetting）。因此，理解并缓解顺序编辑带来的性能下降问题是本研究的动机。

Method: 本文提出SPHERE（Sparse Projection for Hyperspherical Energy-Regularized Editing）方法，这是一种受超球能量（Hyperspherical Energy, HE）驱动的正则化策略。具体而言，SPHERE首先识别出预训练权重矩阵主超球方向的互补稀疏空间，然后将新知识投影到该空间上，从而减弱对主方向的扰动，以稳定神经元权重分布，并最终在能够进行可靠顺序更新的同时，保持原有知识。

Result: 通过对LLaMA3 (8B) 和 Qwen2.5 (7B) 进行的大量实验表明，SPHERE 在编辑能力方面比现有的最优基线方法平均提高了 16.41%，并且在保持模型整体性能方面也表现出色。

Conclusion: 超球均匀性（Hyperspherical uniformity）有助于模型在接受更新时保持稳定并保留先验知识。本文通过量化神经元均匀性的超球能量（HE）发现，HE的波动与编辑性能密切相关，编辑失败时HE会剧烈波动。理论分析也证实HE的稳定性对于知识保留至关重要。基于这些发现，SPHERE方法通过正则化策略稳定了神经元权重分布，为实现可靠的大规模知识编辑提供了一个有原则的途径。

Abstract: Large language models (LLMs) require constant updates to remain aligned with
evolving real-world knowledge. Model editing offers a lightweight alternative
to retraining, but sequential editing often destabilizes representations and
induces catastrophic forgetting. In this work, we seek to better understand and
mitigate performance degradation caused by sequential editing. We hypothesize
that hyperspherical uniformity, a property that maintains uniform distribution
of neuron weights on a hypersphere, helps the model remain stable, retain prior
knowledge, while still accommodate new updates. We use Hyperspherical Energy
(HE) to quantify neuron uniformity during editing, and examine its correlation
with editing performance. Empirical studies across widely used editing methods
reveals a strong correlation between HE dynamics and editing performance, with
editing failures consistently coinciding with high HE fluctuations. We further
theoretically prove that HE dynamics impose a lower bound on the degradation of
pretrained knowledge, highlighting why HE stability is crucial for knowledge
retention. Motivated by these insights, we propose SPHERE (Sparse Projection
for Hyperspherical Energy-Regularized Editing), an HE-driven regularization
strategy that stabilizes neuron weight distributions, ultimately preserving
prior knowledge while enabling reliable sequential updates. Specifically,
SPHERE identifies a sparse space complementary to the principal hyperspherical
directions of the pretrained weight matrices and projects new knowledge onto
it, attenuating perturbations on the principal directions. Extensive
experiments on LLaMA3 (8B) and Qwen2.5 (7B) show that SPHERE outperforms the
best baseline in editing capability by an average of 16.41%, while most
faithfully preserving general model performance, thereby offering a principled
path toward reliable large-scale knowledge editing.

</details>


<div id='cs.SI'></div>

# cs.SI [[Back]](#toc)

### [155] [FTSCommDetector: Discovering Behavioral Communities through Temporal Synchronization](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.00014)
*Tianyang Luo,Xikun Zhang,Dongjin Song*

Main category: cs.SI

TL;DR: FTSCommDetector通过TCA模型，利用双尺度编码和动态注意力机制，在金融市场时间序列分析中有效识别同步与不同步的社群，克服了传统方法的局限性，并实现了性能提升。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 现有社群侦测方法无法捕捉实体在关键时刻独立移动但又协同变化的同步-不同步模式，这导致了对像AAPL和MSFT这样在市场动荡期间展现不同反应模式的科技巨头的分析局限。

Method: 提出了一种名为FTSCommDetector的框架，该框架实现了时间相干性架构（TCA），用于发现连续多变量时间序列中相似和不相似的社群。该方法通过双尺度编码和静态拓扑与动态注意力相结合来保持相干性，解决了传统方法在处理每个时间戳时会丢失演化关系的问题。此外，还建立了信息论基础来证明尺度分离如何最大化互补信息，并引入了归一化时间剖面（NTP）进行尺度不变评估。

Result: FTSCommDetector在四个不同的金融市场（SP100、SP500、SP1000、日经225）上实现了持续的性能提升，相较于最强的基线方法，增幅在3.5%到11.1%之间。该方法在60天到120天的窗口大小变化下，性能仅有2%的波动，展现了卓越的鲁棒性，无需进行数据集特定的调优。

Conclusion: FTSCommDetector在金融市场的时间序列分析中，能够一致且稳健地识别出同步和不同步的社群，其性能优于现有方法，并为投资组合构建和风险管理提供了实用的见解。

Abstract: Why do trillion-dollar tech giants AAPL and MSFT diverge into different
response patterns during market disruptions despite identical sector
classifications? This paradox reveals a fundamental limitation: traditional
community detection methods fail to capture synchronization-desynchronization
patterns where entities move independently yet align during critical moments.
To this end, we introduce FTSCommDetector, implementing our Temporal Coherence
Architecture (TCA) to discover similar and dissimilar communities in continuous
multivariate time series. Unlike existing methods that process each timestamp
independently, causing unstable community assignments and missing evolving
relationships, our approach maintains coherence through dual-scale encoding and
static topology with dynamic attention. Furthermore, we establish
information-theoretic foundations demonstrating how scale separation maximizes
complementary information and introduce Normalized Temporal Profiles (NTP) for
scale-invariant evaluation. As a result, FTSCommDetector achieves consistent
improvements across four diverse financial markets (SP100, SP500, SP1000,
Nikkei 225), with gains ranging from 3.5% to 11.1% over the strongest
baselines. The method demonstrates remarkable robustness with only 2%
performance variation across window sizes from 60 to 120 days, making
dataset-specific tuning unnecessary, providing practical insights for portfolio
construction and risk management.

</details>


### [156] [When Life Paths Cross: Extracting Human Interactions in Time and Space from Wikipedia](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.00019)
*Zhongyang Liu,Ying Zhang,Xiangyi Xiao,Wenting Liu,Yuanting Zha,Haipeng Zhang*

Main category: cs.SI

TL;DR: 本研究解决了传记数据中交互信息稀疏的问题，提取了维基百科中的交互记录，并提出了一个基于注意力机制、多任务学习和特征迁移的模型，该模型在政治人物交互分析方面取得了优异的成果，并公开了相关数据和代码。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 传记中的人物交互包含了丰富的文化、经济、政治、科学和历史信息，但现有研究受限于数据稀疏性，特别是缺少具体的时间和地点信息。

Method: 从维基百科中提取了685,966条交互记录（人物1，人物2，时间，地点），并设计了一个整合了注意力机制、多任务学习和特征迁移的模型来处理文本中的交互信息，最终达到了86.51%的F1分数。

Result: 该模型在提取交互记录方面优于基线模型，并且通过对美国政治人物的交互分析，展示了提取数据的潜力，例如揭示政治极化现象。

Conclusion: 本研究成功地从维基百科的传记页面中提取了大量人物交互数据，并通过提出的模型有效解决了数据稀疏和信息提取的挑战，为后续的跨学科研究提供了宝贵的数据集和工具。

Abstract: Interactions among notable individuals -- whether examined individually, in
groups, or as networks -- often convey significant messages across cultural,
economic, political, scientific, and historical perspectives. By analyzing the
times and locations of these interactions, we can observe how dynamics unfold
across regions over time. However, relevant studies are often constrained by
data scarcity, particularly concerning the availability of specific location
and time information. To address this issue, we mine millions of biography
pages from Wikipedia, extracting 685,966 interaction records in the form of
(Person1, Person2, Time, Location) interaction quadruplets. The key elements of
these interactions are often scattered throughout the heterogeneous
crowd-sourced text and may be loosely or indirectly associated. We overcome
this challenge by designing a model that integrates attention mechanisms,
multi-task learning, and feature transfer methods, achieving an F1 score of
86.51%, which outperforms baseline models. We further conduct an empirical
analysis of intra- and inter-party interactions among political figures to
examine political polarization in the US, showcasing the potential of the
extracted data from a perspective that may not be possible without this data.
We make our code, the extracted interaction data, and the WikiInteraction
dataset of 4,507 labeled interaction quadruplets publicly available.

</details>


### [157] [IA aplicada al análisis del conflicto Irán-Israel: Mapeo de discursos en YouTube](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.00021)
*Alvaro Vallejo Ramírez*

Main category: cs.SI

TL;DR: 本研究分析了2025年6月伊朗-以色列冲突的数字表征，基于YouTube上的120,000条评论，旨在识别参与者的论述立场，并检视媒体和算法偏见如何塑造数字对话。研究采用混合方法设计，结合了自然语言处理、机器学习（BERT和XLM-RoBERTa）以及批判性媒体分析。结果显示，亲巴勒斯坦和反美/反以色列的论述被明显过度代表，而亲美和反巴勒斯坦的立场则处于边缘。尽管伊朗在全球媒体中常被忽视，但在数字对话中却成为冲突的关键角色，显示叙事框架的转变。研究证实了算法偏见在放大某些论述和限制其他论述方面的影响力。本研究结合了计算分析和哲学批判，为研究数字争议提供了一个可复制的方法论框架，并突显了常被忽视的不对称性和叙事争议。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 本研究旨在分析2025年6月伊朗-以色列冲突在YouTube上的数字表征，识别论述立场，并探讨媒体和算法偏见如何影响数字对话。

Method: 研究采用了混合方法设计，包括使用自然语言处理和机器学习模型（BERT和XLM-RoBERTa）对120,000条YouTube评论进行分类，以及结合媒体背景、意识形态叙事进行批判性分析，并通过手动标注和监督训练进行补充。

Result: 研究发现，亲巴勒斯坦和反美/反以色列的论述在YouTube评论中被显著过度代表，而亲美和反巴勒斯坦的立场则相对边缘。伊朗在全球媒体中通常不被关注，但在该冲突的数字对话中却成为中心角色，表明叙事框架可能发生转变。此外，研究证实了算法偏见在放大某些论述和限制其他论述方面的影响。

Conclusion: 本研究结合了计算分析和哲学批判，为研究数字争议提供了一个可复制的方法论框架，突显了常被忽视的不对称性和叙事争议，并且是首批使用人工智能和批判性分析来研究YouTube上国际冲突论述的西班牙语研究之一。

Abstract: Purpose. This study analyzes the digital representation of the Iran-Israel
conflict that occurred in June 2025, based on 120,000 comments posted on
YouTube. It sought to identify discursive positions regarding the actors
involved and to examine how media and algorithmic biases shape digital
conversations. Methodology. A mixed-methods design with triangulation was
adopted. In the quantitative phase, natural language processing techniques and
machine learning models (BERT and XLM-RoBERTa) were used to classify comments
into ten categories. In the qualitative phase, a critical analysis of media
context and ideological narratives was conducted, complemented by manual
annotation and supervised training. This strategy enabled the integration of
statistical robustness with contextual understanding. Results and conclusions.
The findings reveal a clear overrepresentation of pro-Palestinian and
anti-United States/Israel discourses, while pro-United States and
anti-Palestinian positions were marginal. Iran, usually rendered invisible in
global media, emerged as a central actor in the digital conversation during the
conflict, suggesting a narrative shift away from previous hegemonic frameworks.
Likewise, the results confirm the influence of algorithmic biases in amplifying
certain discourses while limiting others. Original contributions. This work
combines computational analysis and philosophical critique for the study of
digital controversies, providing a methodological framework replicable in
geopolitical contexts. It is one of the first Spanish-language studies to map,
through artificial intelligence and critical analysis, discourses on an
international conflict on YouTube, highlighting asymmetries and narrative
disputes that are often overlooked.

</details>


### [158] [EpidemIQs: Prompt-to-Paper LLM Agents for Epidemic Modeling and Analysis](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.00024)
*Mohammad Hossein Samaei,Faryad Darabi Sahneh,Lee W. Cohnstaedt,Caterina Scoglio*

Main category: cs.SI

TL;DR: EpidemIQs是一个新的多代理LLM框架，可以自动化复杂的流行病学研究，包括文献综述、模型推导、模拟和报告生成，其成本低廉且成功率高。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 流行病学建模复杂且需要跨学科知识，是一个利用LLM自动化进行研究的理想领域。

Method: 提出了一种名为EpidemIQs的多代理LLM框架，包含一个进行规划和协调的科学家代理和一个专注于特定任务的任务专家代理。该框架能够自主完成文献综述、分析推导、网络建模、机制建模、随机模拟、数据可视化与分析以及报告撰写等一系列研究任务。

Result: EpidemIQs框架能够生成完整的科学论文格式报告，使用GPT 4.1和GPT 4.1 mini作为基础模型，平均每个研究的总代币使用量为870K，成本约为1.57美元，成功率为100%。与单代理LLM相比，EpidemIQs在不同场景下表现出持续更高的性能。

Conclusion: EpidemIQs通过显著降低成本和缩短发现过程的周转时间，并提高高级建模工具的可及性，代表了加速科学研究的一项进步。

Abstract: Large Language Models (LLMs) offer new opportunities to automate complex
interdisciplinary research domains. Epidemic modeling, characterized by its
complexity and reliance on network science, dynamical systems, epidemiology,
and stochastic simulations, represents a prime candidate for leveraging
LLM-driven automation. We introduce \textbf{EpidemIQs}, a novel multi-agent LLM
framework that integrates user inputs and autonomously conducts literature
review, analytical derivation, network modeling, mechanistic modeling,
stochastic simulations, data visualization and analysis, and finally
documentation of findings in a structured manuscript. We introduced two types
of agents: a scientist agent for planning, coordination, reflection, and
generation of final results, and a task-expert agent to focus exclusively on
one specific duty serving as a tool to the scientist agent. The framework
consistently generated complete reports in scientific article format.
Specifically, using GPT 4.1 and GPT 4.1 mini as backbone LLMs for scientist and
task-expert agents, respectively, the autonomous process completed with average
total token usage 870K at a cost of about \$1.57 per study, achieving a 100\%
completion success rate through our experiments. We evaluate EpidemIQs across
different epidemic scenarios, measuring computational cost, completion success
rate, and AI and human expert reviews of generated reports. We compare
EpidemIQs to the single-agent LLM, which has the same system prompts and tools,
iteratively planning, invoking tools, and revising outputs until task
completion. The comparison shows consistently higher performance of the
proposed framework across five different scenarios. EpidemIQs represents a step
forward in accelerating scientific research by significantly reducing costs and
turnaround time of discovery processes, and enhancing accessibility to advanced
modeling tools.

</details>


### [159] [Modeling Product Ecosystems](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.00036)
*Tridib Banerjee*

Main category: cs.SI

TL;DR: 该论文提出了一个动态系统框架来模拟产品采纳网络中的影响传播，并将其构建为一个具有梅茨勒（Metzler）交互矩阵和基于效用的衰减的正线性系统。利用矩阵指数和皮亚诺-贝克（Peano--Baker）级数，对恒定、分段恒定和完全时变的交互结构推导出了精确解。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 开发一个动态系统框架来模拟产品采纳网络中的影响传播。

Method: 将模型构建为一个具有梅茨勒（Metzler）交互矩阵和基于效用的衰减的正线性系统，并利用矩阵指数和皮亚诺-贝克（Peano--Baker）级数推导出精确解。

Result: （i）正交互保证非负放大；（ii）感知效用在约3个互补添加后饱和（韦伯-费希纳定律）；（iii）可比较引入的频率比增量质量改进更重要；（iv）强化交互产生单调收益，而衰减控制效果不明确；（v）SIS类型动态下的长期留存受采纳图的逆谱半径的限制。

Conclusion: 这些结果将疫情阈值理论和正系统分析扩展到网络采纳，为网络上的影响动态提供了明确的、可校准的表达式。

Abstract: This paper develops a dynamical-systems framework for modeling influence
propagation in product adoption networks, formulated as a positive linear
system with Metzler interaction matrices and utility-based decay. Exact
solutions are derived for constant, piecewise-constant, and fully time-varying
interaction structures using matrix exponentials and the Peano--Baker series.
It establishes five results: (i) positive interactions guarantee nonnegative
amplification, (ii) perceived utility saturates after $\approx\!3$
complementary additions (Weber--Fechner), (iii) frequency of comparable
introductions dominates incremental quality improvements, (iv) reinforcing
interactions yields monotone gains while decay control gives ambiguous effects,
and (v) long-run retention under SIS-type dynamics is bounded by the inverse
spectral radius of the adoption graph. These results extend epidemic-threshold
theory and positive-systems analysis to networked adoption, yielding explicit,
calibratable expressions for influence dynamics on networks.

</details>


### [160] [SoREX: Towards Self-Explainable Social Recommendation with Relevant Ego-Path Extraction](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.00080)
*Hanze Guo,Yijun Ma,Xiao Zhou*

Main category: cs.SI

TL;DR: SoREX是一个基于GNN的自解释社交推荐框架，通过引入新颖的自我路径提取方法来提供可解释性，并在多个基准数据集上验证了其预测准确性和解释的有效性。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 现有的基于GNN的社交推荐方法缺乏提供有意义的预测解释的能力。

Method: SoREX采用双塔模型，结合好友推荐，独立建模社交关系和用户-item交互，并通过辅助任务强化社交信号。通过将目标用户的自我网络转化为多跳自我路径，并提取因子特定和候选感知的自我路径子集来提供解释，最后进行解释再聚合以关联解释和预测。

Result: 在四个广泛使用的数据集上进行了综合实验，验证了SoREX在预测准确性方面的有效性，并通过定性和定量分析确认了其提取的解释的有效性。

Conclusion: SoREX框架能够提供准确的预测，并生成有效的、与预测相关的自我解释。

Abstract: Social recommendation has been proven effective in addressing data sparsity
in user-item interaction modeling by leveraging social networks. The recent
integration of Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) has further enhanced prediction
accuracy in contemporary social recommendation algorithms. However, many
GNN-based approaches in social recommendation lack the ability to furnish
meaningful explanations for their predictions. In this study, we confront this
challenge by introducing SoREX, a self-explanatory GNN-based social
recommendation framework. SoREX adopts a two-tower framework enhanced by friend
recommendation, independently modeling social relations and user-item
interactions, while jointly optimizing an auxiliary task to reinforce social
signals. To offer explanations, we propose a novel ego-path extraction
approach. This method involves transforming the ego-net of a target user into a
collection of multi-hop ego-paths, from which we extract factor-specific and
candidate-aware ego-path subsets as explanations. This process facilitates the
summarization of detailed comparative explanations among different candidate
items through intricate substructure analysis. Furthermore, we conduct
explanation re-aggregation to explicitly correlate explanations with downstream
predictions, imbuing our framework with inherent self-explainability.
Comprehensive experiments conducted on four widely adopted benchmark datasets
validate the effectiveness of SoREX in predictive accuracy. Additionally,
qualitative and quantitative analyses confirm the efficacy of the extracted
explanations in SoREX. Our code and data are available at
https://github.com/antman9914/SoREX.

</details>


### [161] [Mobility Behavior Evolution During Extended Emergencies: Returners, Explorers, and the 15-Minute City](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.00469)
*Omid Armantalab,Jason Hawkins,Wissam Kontar*

Main category: cs.SI

TL;DR: 该研究利用YJMob100K数据集，分析了在为期15天的紧急情况期间，城市居民在“回归者”（常去固定地点）和“探索者”（常去广泛地点）之间的流动性转变，并结合了15分钟城市的概念。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 理解人类在紧急情况下的流动性对于加强城市韧性和指导应急管理至关重要。

Method: 利用高分辨率空间数据，分析了流动性随时间、紧急情况持续时间、工作日/周末以及邻里边界的变化，并将其与15分钟城市框架联系起来。

Result: 研究发现，至少需要两周的数据才能检测到有意义的行为变化。在长期紧急情况下，人们恢复访问非必要地点的速度比正常情况下慢。探索者明显减少了长距离旅行，而周末和节假日则表现出类似回归者的短距离模式。低兴趣点（POI）密度社区的居民经常前往POI丰富的地区，这凸显了空间差异。加强当地可达性可能有助于在危机期间提高城市韧性。

Conclusion: 通过加强当地可达性，可以提高城市在危机期间的韧性。

Abstract: Understanding human mobility during emergencies is critical for strengthening
urban resilience and guiding emergency management. This study examines
transitions between returners, who repeatedly visit a limited set of locations,
and explorers, who travel across broader destinations, over a 15-day emergency
period in a densely populated metropolitan region using the YJMob100K dataset.
High-resolution spatial data reveal intra-urban behavioral dynamics often
masked at coarser scales. Beyond static comparisons, we analyze how mobility
evolves over time, with varying emergency durations, across weekdays and
weekends, and relative to neighborhood boundaries, linking the analysis to the
15-minute city framework.
  Results show that at least two weeks of data are required to detect
meaningful behavioral shifts. During prolonged emergencies, individuals resume
visits to non-essential locations more slowly than under normal conditions.
Explorers markedly reduce long distance travel, while weekends and holidays
consistently exhibit returner-like, short distance patterns. Residents of low
Points of Interest (POI) density neighborhoods often travel to POI rich areas,
highlighting spatial disparities. Strengthening local accessibility may improve
urban resilience during crises.
  Full reproducibility is supported through the project website:
https://github.com/wissamkontar

</details>


### [162] [Threats to the sustainability of Community Notes on X](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.00650)
*Zahra Arjmandi-Lari,Alexios Mantzarlis,Tom Stafford*

Main category: cs.SI

TL;DR: X上的社群笔记系统利用其桥接算法识别跨越政治分歧的用户生成内容，但其社群稳定性和用户贡献动机仍需考量。研究采用回归不连续设计分析了笔记被标记为“有效”对未来笔记撰写的影响，发现被标记的笔记能正向激励用户继续贡献。然而，该系统目前“有效”笔记的比例仅为10%，且呈下降趋势，这揭示了潜在风险，并对X及其他平台的社群笔记未来发展具有启示意义。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 为了理解X（前身为Twitter）社群笔记系统的社群性质，特别是鉴于该功能已被其他平台模仿，并探究除党派敌意外，可能驱使用户贡献的动机。

Method: 利用回归不连续设计（regression discontinuity design），分析笔记被“有效”（经桥接算法判定）后对未来笔记撰写的影响，以获得比传统观察数据分析方法更强的因果推断。

Result: 研究表明，一篇笔记被标记为“有效”能够对其作者未来的笔记撰写产生积极影响。然而，当前系统中被标记为“有效”的笔记比例较低（10%）且呈下降趋势。

Conclusion: X的社群笔记系统存在风险，因为被标记为“有效”的笔记比例低且呈下降趋势。这一分析结果对X及其他模仿该机制的平台的社群笔记未来发展具有重要意义。

Abstract: Community Notes are emerging as an important option for content moderation.
The Community Notes system pioneered by Twitter, now known as X, uses a
bridging algorithm to identify user-generated context with upvotes across
political divides, supposedly spinning consensual gold from partisan straw. It
is important to understand the nature of the community behind Community Notes,
especially as the feature has now been imitated by several billion-user
platforms. We look for signs of stability and disruption in the X Community
Notes community and interrogate the motivations other than partisan animus
(Allen, Martel, and Rand 2022) which may be driving users to contribute. We
conduct a novel analysis of the impact of having a note published, which
requires being considered "helpful" by the bridging algorithm, utilising a
regression discontinuity design. This allows stronger causal inference than
conventional methods used with observational data. Our analysis shows the
positive effect on future note authoring of having a note published. This
highlights the risk of the current system, where the proportion of notes
considered "helpful" (and therefore shown to users on X) is low, 10%, and
declining. This analysis has implications for the future of Community Notes on
X and the extension of this approach to other platforms.

</details>


### [163] [Discovering Communities in Continuous-Time Temporal Networks by Optimizing L-Modularity](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.00741)
*Victor Brabant,Angela Bonifati,Rémy Cazabet*

Main category: cs.SI

TL;DR: LAGO是一个新颖的动态社区检测方法，通过贪婪优化纵向模块度来捕捉节点进入和退出社区的精确时刻，适用于连续时间网络，并在合成基准和真实世界数据集上进行了评估。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 社区检测是网络分析中的一个基本问题，具有广泛的应用。然而，在保持精确的时间准确性的同时将社区检测扩展到时间领域，需要专门针对交互的时间性质进行调整的方法。

Method: LAGO通过贪婪优化纵向模块度来检测动态社区，这是一种针对连续时间网络的模块度改编。该方法能够捕捉节点进入和退出社区的确切时间点，而无需依赖时间离散化或假设严格的社区演变。

Result: 在合成基准和真实世界数据集上的评估表明，LAGO能够有效地检测出在时间和拓扑上都连贯的社区。

Conclusion: LAGO是一种新颖的动态社区检测方法，通过优化纵向模块度，能够精确捕捉节点在社区中的动态变化，并能有效应用于各种数据集。

Abstract: Community detection is a fundamental problem in network analysis, with many
applications in various fields. Extending community detection to the temporal
setting with exact temporal accuracy, as required by real-world dynamic data,
necessitates methods specifically adapted to the temporal nature of
interactions. We introduce LAGO, a novel method for uncovering dynamic
communities by greedy optimization of Longitudinal Modularity, a specific
adaptation of Modularity for continuous-time networks. Unlike prior approaches
that rely on time discretization or assume rigid community evolution, LAGO
captures the precise moments when nodes enter and exit communities. We evaluate
LAGO on synthetic benchmarks and real-world datasets, demonstrating its ability
to efficiently uncover temporally and topologically coherent communities.

</details>


<div id='cs.DC'></div>

# cs.DC [[Back]](#toc)

### [164] [Lattica: A Decentralized Cross-NAT Communication Framework for Scalable AI Inference and Training](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.00183)
*Ween Yang,Jason Liu,Suli Wang,Xinyuan Song,Lynn Ai,Eric Yang,Tianyu Shi*

Main category: cs.DC

TL;DR: Lattica是一个去中心化的跨NAT通信框架，用于支持分布式AI系统，解决了现有解决方案在异构和无许可环境下的限制。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 分布式AI工作负载的快速扩展需要新的通信基板，但现有解决方案无法满足在NAT和防火墙限制下的异构和无许可环境的要求。

Method: Lattica集成了NAT穿透机制、基于CRDT的去中心化数据存储以及基于DHT的内容发现层和优化的RPC协议。

Result: Lattica提供了一个完整的协议栈，实现了主权、弹性、可扩展且独立于中心化中介的AI系统。

Conclusion: Lattica适用于边缘智能、协作强化学习和其他大规模分布式机器学习场景。

Abstract: The rapid expansion of distributed Artificial Intelligence (AI) workloads
beyond centralized data centers creates a demand for new communication
substrates. These substrates must operate reliably in heterogeneous and
permissionless environments, where Network Address Translators (NATs) and
firewalls impose significant constraints. Existing solutions, however, are
either designed for controlled data center deployments or implemented as
monolithic systems that tightly couple machine learning logic with networking
code. To address these limitations, we present Lattica, a decentralized
cross-NAT communication framework designed to support distributed AI systems.
Lattica integrates three core components. First, it employs a robust suite of
NAT traversal mechanisms to establish a globally addressable peer-to-peer mesh.
Second, it provides a decentralized data store based on Conflict-free
Replicated Data Types (CRDTs), ensuring verifiable and eventually consistent
state replication. Third, it incorporates a content discovery layer that
leverages distributed hash tables (DHTs) together with an optimized RPC
protocol for efficient model synchronization. By integrating these components,
Lattica delivers a complete protocol stack for sovereign, resilient, and
scalable AI systems that operate independently of centralized intermediaries.
It is directly applicable to edge intelligence, collaborative reinforcement
learning, and other large-scale distributed machine learning scenarios.

</details>


### [165] [FlowMoE: A Scalable Pipeline Scheduling Framework for Distributed Mixture-of-Experts Training](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.00207)
*Yunqi Gao,Bing Hu,Mahdi Boloursaz Mashhadi,A-Long Jin,Yanfeng Zhang,Pei Xiao,Rahim Tafazolli,Merouane Debbah*

Main category: cs.DC

TL;DR: FlowMoE是一个用于调度多类型任务流水线的可扩展框架，通过统一流水线和基于张量块的优先级调度机制，优化了分布式MoE训练的效率，显著减少了训练时间、能耗和内存使用。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 现有的分布式MoE训练方法主要关注MoE层内部的任务调度，如专家计算和all-to-all通信，而忽略了多头注意力计算、门控和all-reduce通信等关键操作，导致训练效率有待提高。

Method: FlowMoE构建了一个统一的流水线，用于调度多头注意力计算、门控、专家计算和all-to-all通信。此外，它引入了一种基于张量块的优先级调度机制，以将all-reduce通信与所有计算任务进行重叠。

Result: FlowMoE在675个典型的MoE层和四个真实世界的MoE模型上进行了广泛实验，与现有的MoE训练框架相比，训练时间减少了13%-57%，能耗降低了10%-39%，内存使用量减少了7%-32%。

Conclusion: FlowMoE是一个有效的、可扩展的框架，通过优化分布式MoE训练中的多类型任务流水线调度，显著提高了训练效率，降低了资源消耗。

Abstract: The parameter size of modern large language models (LLMs) can be scaled up
via the sparsely-activated Mixture-of-Experts (MoE) technique to avoid
excessive increase of the computational costs. To further improve training
efficiency, pipelining computation and communication has become a promising
solution for distributed MoE training. However, existing work primarily focuses
on scheduling tasks within the MoE layer, such as expert computing and
all-to-all (A2A) communication, while neglecting other key operations including
multi-head attention (MHA) computing, gating, and all-reduce communication. In
this paper, we propose FlowMoE, a scalable framework for scheduling multi-type
task pipelines. First, FlowMoE constructs a unified pipeline to consistently
scheduling MHA computing, gating, expert computing, and A2A communication.
Second, FlowMoE introduces a tensor chunk-based priority scheduling mechanism
to overlap the all-reduce communication with all computing tasks. We implement
FlowMoE as an adaptive and generic framework atop PyTorch. Extensive
experiments with 675 typical MoE layers and four real-world MoE models across
two GPU clusters demonstrate that our proposed FlowMoE framework outperforms
state-of-the-art MoE training frameworks, reducing training time by 13%-57%,
energy consumption by 10%-39%, and memory usage by 7%-32%.

</details>


### [166] [BlockSDN-VC: A SDN-Based Virtual Coordinate-Enhanced Transaction Broadcast Framework for High-Performance Blockchains](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.00306)
*Wenyang Jia,Jingjing Wang,Kai Lei*

Main category: cs.DC

TL;DR: BlockSDN-VC是一种交易广播协议，通过在SDN控制器中集中坐标计算和转发控制，实现全球一致性、最小路径拉伸和对节点变化的快速响应，从而提高区块链的传播速度和吞吐量。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 现代区块链需要快速可靠的传播来平衡安全性和吞吐量，但现有的虚拟坐标方法更新缓慢，导致节点不同步。

Method: 提出BlockSDN-VC协议，将坐标计算和转发控制集中在SDN控制器，利用SDN的全局视图来优化交易传播。

Result: 在模拟中，BlockSDN-VC将中值延迟降低了高达62%，并将收敛速度加快了四倍，同时控制平面开销低于3%。在实际区块链环境中，BlockSDN-VC将确认交易的吞吐量提高了17%。

Conclusion: BlockSDN-VC通过集中式SDN控制器提高了区块链的交易传播效率和吞吐量，且无需修改现有客户端。

Abstract: Modern blockchains need fast, reliable propagation to balance security and
throughput. Virtual-coordinate methods speed dissemination but rely on slow
iterative updates, leaving nodes out of sync. We present BlockSDN-VC, a
transaction-broadcast protocol that centralises coordinate computation and
forwarding control in an SDN controller, delivering global consistency, minimal
path stretch and rapid response to churn or congestion. In geo-distributed
simulations, BlockSDN-VC cuts median latency by up to 62% and accelerates
convergence fourfold over state-of-the-art schemes with under 3% control-plane
overhead. In a real blockchain environment, BlockSDN-VC boosts
confirmed-transaction throughput by 17% under adversarial workloads, requiring
no modifications to existing clients.

</details>


### [167] [ThirstyFLOPS: Water Footprint Modeling and Analysis Toward Sustainable HPC Systems](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.00471)
*Yankai Jiang,Raghavendra Kanakagiri,Rohan Basu Roy,Devesh Tiwari*

Main category: cs.DC

TL;DR: 该论文提出了一个名为ThirstyFLOPS的分析框架，用于评估高性能计算（HPC）系统日益增长的水足迹，并使用实际数据和地区特定指标来量化水消耗，以促进水资源可持续性。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: HPC系统因水冷和电力消耗而变得越来越耗水，但其水足迹却被忽视，因此需要一个全面的分析框架来解决这一问题。

Method: 该方法结合了地区特定的指标，如用水效率（WUE）、电力使用效率（PUE）和能源水因子（EWF），并使用实际数据来量化HPC系统的水消耗。

Result: 通过对Marconi、Fugaku、Polaris和Frontier四个代表性HPC系统的分析，该研究揭示了地区水资源短缺和核能策略对HPC可持续性的影响。

Conclusion: 该研究旨在通过提供对HPC系统水足迹的全面理解，并考虑地区差异和能源策略，来推动水资源感知和环境负责的计算基础设施的发展。

Abstract: High-performance computing (HPC) systems are becoming increasingly
water-intensive due to their reliance on water-based cooling and the energy
used in power generation. However, the water footprint of HPC remains
relatively underexplored-especially in contrast to the growing focus on carbon
emissions. In this paper, we present ThirstyFLOPS - a comprehensive water
footprint analysis framework for HPC systems. Our approach incorporates
region-specific metrics, including Water Usage Effectiveness, Power Usage
Effectiveness, and Energy Water Factor, to quantify water consumption using
real-world data. Using four representative HPC systems - Marconi, Fugaku,
Polaris, and Frontier - as examples, we provide implications for HPC system
planning and management. We explore the impact of regional water scarcity and
nuclear-based energy strategies on HPC sustainability. Our findings aim to
advance the development of water-aware, environmentally responsible computing
infrastructures.

</details>


### [168] [Towards Efficient VM Placement: A Two-Stage ACO-PSO Approach for Green Cloud Infrastructure](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.00541)
*Ali M. Baydoun,Ahmed S. Zekri*

Main category: cs.DC

TL;DR: 该论文提出了一种混合天牛群优化-粒子群优化（HAPSO）算法，用于解决绿色云计算数据中心中能源感知的虚拟机（VM）放置和迁移问题。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 鉴于数据中心日益增长的能源消耗，需要可持续的资源管理。

Method: 该方法采用两阶段混合优化策略：第一阶段使用天牛群优化（ACO）进行全局最优的初始放置，第二阶段使用粒子群优化（PSO）进行局部优化和虚拟机迁移。HAPSO算法的创新点包括：元启发式算法的顺序混合、基于ACO输出的系统感知粒子初始化、用于约束处理的启发式离散化以及最小化活动服务器和资源浪费的多目标适应度函数。

Result: 在CloudSimPlus中实现的HAPSO算法，通过大量仿真表明，其在能源消耗和SLA违规方面优于传统的启发式算法（BFD、FFD）、统一天牛群系统（UACS）和纯ACO算法。与UACS相比，HAPSO在处理大规模工作负载时，能源消耗最多可降低25%，SLA违规减少18%，同时保持成本和碳排放稳定。

Conclusion: 两阶段的仿生启发式混合方法在解决云计算资源管理的动态性和多目标性方面是有效的。

Abstract: Datacenters consume a growing share of energy, prompting the need for
sustainable resource management. This paper presents a Hybrid ACO-PSO (HAPSO)
algorithm for energy-aware virtual machine (VM) placement and migration in
green cloud datacenters. In the first stage, Ant Colony Optimization (ACO)
performs energy-efficient initial placement across physical hosts, ensuring
global feasibility. In the second stage, a discrete Particle Swarm Optimization
(PSO) refines allocations by migrating VMs from overloaded or underutilized
hosts. HAPSO introduces several innovations: sequential hybridization of
metaheuristics, system-informed particle initialization using ACO output,
heuristic-guided discretization for constraint handling, and a multi-objective
fitness function that minimizes active servers and resource wastage.
Implemented in CloudSimPlus, extensive simulations demonstrate that HAPSO
consistently outperforms classical heuristics (BFD, FFD), Unified Ant Colony
System (UACS), and ACO-only. Notably, HAPSO achieves up to 25% lower energy
consumption and 18% fewer SLA violations compared to UACS at large-scale
workloads, while sustaining stable cost and carbon emissions. These results
highlight the effectiveness of two-stage bio-inspired hybridization in
addressing the dynamic and multi-objective nature of cloud resource management.

</details>


### [169] [ElasWave: An Elastic-Native System for Scalable Hybrid-Parallel Training](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.00606)
*Xueze Kang,Guangyu Xiang,Yuxin Wang,Hao Zhang,Yuchu Fang,Yuhang Zhou,Zhenheng Tang,Youhui Lv,Eliran Maman,Mark Wasserman,Alon Zameret,Zhipeng Bian,Shushu Chen,Zhiyou Yu,Jin Wang,Xiaoyu Wu,Yang Zheng,Chen Tian,Xiaowen Chu*

Main category: cs.DC

TL;DR: ElasWave是一个弹性原生训练系统，通过多维度调度（图、数据流、频率、随机数生成）实现每步容错，提高了吞吐量和恢复速度，同时保持了参数和计算的一致性。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 大规模LLM预训练中，硬件故障普遍存在，弹性训练必不可少。现有方法未能同时满足参数一致性、低恢复时间（MTTR）、高吞吐量和计算一致性这四个关键目标。

Method: ElasWave通过多维度调度实现每步容错，包括：1. 调整微批次工作负载的大小和重分片，同时保持全局批次大小和梯度尺度不变。2. 在线流水线重分片，结合异步参数迁移和ZeRO分区交错，使恢复简化为独立的秩间传输。3. 使用DVFS吸收流水线气泡。4. 重分片RNG以保持计算一致性。5. 动态通信器支持原地通信组编辑。6. 每步内存快照支持在线验证和重新分发。

Result: 在96个NPU上评估，ElasWave相比基线方法：吞吐量提升1.35倍（对比ReCycle）和1.60倍（对比TorchFT）；通信器恢复时间缩短至1秒内（比完整/部分重建快82倍/3.6倍）；迁移MTTR降低高达51%；收敛偏差减少约78%。

Conclusion: ElasWave成功实现了弹性原生训练，同时满足了参数一致性、低MTTR、高吞吐量和计算一致性这四个关键目标，在LLM预训练中表现出显著优势。

Abstract: Large-scale LLM pretraining today spans $10^{5}$--$10^{6}$ accelerators,
making failures commonplace and elasticity no longer optional. We posit that an
elastic-native training system must simultaneously ensure (i) Parameter
Consistency, (ii) low Mean Time to Recovery (MTTR), (iii) high post-change
Throughput, and (iv) Computation Consistency. This objective set not has never
been jointly attained by prior work. To achieve these goals, we present
ElasWave, which provides per-step fault tolerance via multi-dimensional
scheduling across Graph, Dataflow, Frequency, and Random Number Generation.
ElasWave resizes and reshards micro-batch workloads while preserving the global
batch size and gradient scale; it performs online pipeline resharding with
asynchronous parameter migration, interleaving ZeRO partitions so recovery
reduces to disjoint rank-to-rank transfers. It further uses DVFS to absorb
pipeline bubbles and reshards RNG to keep consistent computations. A dynamic
communicator enables in-place communication group edits, while per-step
in-memory snapshots support online verification and redistribution. We
evaluated ElasWave on 96 NPUs and benchmarked against state-of-the-art
baselines: throughput improves by $1.35\times$ over ReCycle and $1.60\times$
over TorchFT; communicator recovery completes within one second (up to
$82\times/3.6\times$ faster than full/partial rebuilds); migration MTTR drops
by as much as $51\%$; and convergence deviation is reduced by approximately
$78\%$.

</details>


### [170] [Net-Zero 6G from Earth to Orbit: Sustainable Design of Integrated Terrestrial and Non-Terrestrial Networks](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.00678)
*Muhammad Ali Jamshed,Malik Muhammad Saad,Muhammad Ahmed Mohsin,Dongkyun Kim,Octavia A. Dobre,Halim Yanikomeroglu,Lina Mohjazi*

Main category: cs.DC

TL;DR: 该论文首次全面概述了集成太赫兹（TN）和非太赫兹（NTN）系统实现净零能耗目标的相关的设计挑战，并提出了一系列关键的使能技术，以支持此类网络在满足净零目标的同时，支撑其能源需求。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 弥合数字鸿沟，实现第六代（6G）及更高版本真正无处不在的连接。

Method: 通过利用人工智能（AI）的用例分析，为多样化的部署场景提供可适应的解决方案，以提高集成TN和NTN系统的能源效率（EE）。

Result: 提出了关键的使能技术，以支持集成TN和NTN系统在实现净零目标的同时，满足其能源需求。

Conclusion: 展示了有前景的研究方向，以指导集成TN和NTN的可持续发展。

Abstract: The integration of Terrestrial Networks (TN) and Non-Terrestrial Networks
(NTN) plays a crucial role in bridging the digital divide and enabling Sixth
Generation (6G) and beyond to achieve truly ubiquitous connectivity. However,
combining TN and NTN introduces significant energy challenges due to the
diverse characteristics and operational environments of these systems. In this
paper, we present for the first time a comprehensive overview of the design
challenges associated with achieving Net-Zero energy targets in integrated TN
and NTN systems. We outline a set of key enabling technologies that can support
the energy demands of such networks while aligning with Net-Zero objectives. To
enhance the Energy Efficiency (EE) of integrated TN and NTN systems, we provide
a use case analysis that leverages Artificial Intelligence (AI) to deliver
adaptable solutions across diverse deployment scenarios. Finally, we highlight
promising research directions that can guide the sustainable evolution of
integrated TN and NTN.

</details>


### [171] [Decentralized and Self-adaptive Core Maintenance on Temporal Graphs](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.00758)
*Davide Rucci,Emanuele Carlini,Patrizio Dazzi,Hanna Kavalionak,Matteo Mordacchini*

Main category: cs.DC

TL;DR: 该论文提出了一种新颖的、去中心化的、增量的算法，用于计算时间网络的核心分解，通过利用先前计算的核心值来减少节点激活和消息交换，并在大规模真实世界网络上进行了实验评估，证明了其效率。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 核心问题在理解网络拓扑和揭示同质和时间数据中的相似模式方面起着核心作用。这些模式可以通过分析节点形成的社区来揭示，而社区可以通过时间 k-cores 进行有效建模。

Method: 提出了一种新颖的去中心化和增量算法，用于计算时间网络的核心分解。该算法利用先前计算的核心值来减少节点激活和消息交换的数量，从而实现可扩展性，而精度损失最小。

Result: 与最先进的方法相比，该算法在效率方面表现更好，尤其是在活动节点、通信开销和收敛速度方面。

Conclusion: 所提出的去中心化和增量算法在计算时间网络的核心分解方面是高效且可扩展的，并且在实际应用中具有优势。

Abstract: Key graph-based problems play a central role in understanding network
topology and uncovering patterns of similarity in homogeneous and temporal
data. Such patterns can be revealed by analyzing communities formed by nodes,
which in turn can be effectively modeled through temporal $k$-cores. This paper
introduces a novel decentralized and incremental algorithm for computing the
core decomposition of temporal networks. Decentralized solutions leverage the
ability of network nodes to communicate and coordinate locally, addressing
complex problems in a scalable, adaptive, and timely manner. By leveraging
previously computed coreness values, our approach significantly reduces the
activation of nodes and the volume of message exchanges when the network
changes over time. This enables scalability with only a minimal trade-off in
precision. Experimental evaluations on large real-world networks under varying
levels of dynamism demonstrate the efficiency of our solution compared to a
state-of-the-art approach, particularly in terms of active nodes, communication
overhead, and convergence speed.

</details>


### [172] [CGSim: A Simulation Framework for Large Scale Distributed Computing Environment](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.00822)
*Sairam Sri Vatsavai,Raees Khan,Kuan-Chieh Hsu,Ozgur O. Kilic,Paul Nilsson,Tatiana Korchuganova,David K. Park,Sankha Dutta,Yihui Ren,Joseph Boudreau,Tasnuva Chowdhury,Shengyu Feng,Jaehyung Kim,Scott Klasky,Tadashi Maeno,Verena Ingrid Martinez,Norbert Podhorszki,Frédéric Suter,Wei Yang,Yiming Yang,Shinjae Yoo,Alexei Klimentov,Adolfy Hoisie*

Main category: cs.DC

TL;DR: CGSim是一个用于大规模分布式计算环境的模拟框架，解决了现有模拟器的可扩展性、算法硬编码、实时监控和机器学习数据生成等限制。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 大型分布式计算基础设施（如WLCG）需要全面的模拟工具来评估性能、测试新算法和优化资源分配策略，但现有模拟器存在局限性。

Method: CGSim基于SimGrid框架，提供了用于建模异构网格环境的高级抽象，具有模块化插件机制、实时可视化仪表板和AI驱动的性能建模所需的数据集生成功能。

Result: 使用ATLAS PanDA生产工作负载的评估显示，CGSim在WLCG计算站点的校准精度有所提高。可扩展性实验表明，多站点模拟实现了近乎线性的扩展，分布式工作负载的性能比单站点执行提高了6倍。

Conclusion: CGSim能够在标准的商品硬件上，在实际的时间预算限制内，模拟具有数百个站点和数千个并发作业的WLCG规模的基础设施。

Abstract: Large-scale distributed computing infrastructures such as the Worldwide LHC
Computing Grid (WLCG) require comprehensive simulation tools for evaluating
performance, testing new algorithms, and optimizing resource allocation
strategies. However, existing simulators suffer from limited scalability,
hardwired algorithms, lack of real-time monitoring, and inability to generate
datasets suitable for modern machine learning approaches. We present CGSim, a
simulation framework for large-scale distributed computing environments that
addresses these limitations. Built upon the validated SimGrid simulation
framework, CGSim provides high-level abstractions for modeling heterogeneous
grid environments while maintaining accuracy and scalability. Key features
include a modular plugin mechanism for testing custom workflow scheduling and
data movement policies, interactive real-time visualization dashboards, and
automatic generation of event-level datasets suitable for AI-assisted
performance modeling. We demonstrate CGSim's capabilities through a
comprehensive evaluation using production ATLAS PanDA workloads, showing
significant calibration accuracy improvements across WLCG computing sites.
Scalability experiments show near-linear scaling for multi-site simulations,
with distributed workloads achieving 6x better performance compared to
single-site execution. The framework enables researchers to simulate WLCG-scale
infrastructures with hundreds of sites and thousands of concurrent jobs within
practical time budget constraints on commodity hardware.

</details>


### [173] [Data Management System Analysis for Distributed Computing Workloads](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.00828)
*Kuan-Chieh Hsu,Sairam Sri Vatsavai,Ozgur O. Kilic,Tatiana Korchuganova,Paul Nilsson,Sankha Dutta,Yihui Ren,David K. Park,Joseph Boudreau,Tasnuva Chowdhury,Shengyu Feng,Raees Khan,Jaehyung Kim,Scott Klasky,Tadashi Maeno,Verena Ingrid Martinez Outschoorn,Norbert Podhorszki,Frédéric Suter,Wei Yang,Yiming Yang,Shinjae Yoo,Alexei Klimentov,Adolfy Hoisie*

Main category: cs.DC

TL;DR: ATLAS的PanDA工作流系统和Rucio数据管理系统在协同工作时存在效率低下和资源利用不足的问题。本文提出了一种通过文件级链接和元数据匹配来诊断和解决这些问题的方法，以期实现两个系统的协同优化。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 大型国际合作项目（如ATLAS）依赖于全球分布的工作流和数据管理来处理海量数据。然而，PanDA和Rucio系统的组合运行存在系统性效率低下、资源利用不足、数据传输冗余和错误分布改变等问题，并且缺乏共享性能感知和协同适应策略。

Method: 通过元数据匹配算法将PanDA作业和Rucio数据集在文件级别进行链接，从而获得数据访问和移动的完整细粒视图，并识别违反PanDA数据中心作业分配原则的异常传输模式，最后提出缓解策略和加强PanDA-Rucio协同的建议。

Result: 实现了PanDA作业与Rucio数据集的文件级链接，获得了数据访问和移动的细粒视图，识别出异常传输模式，并提出了缓解策略和协同改进Opportunities。

Conclusion: 通过诊断数据管理中的缺陷并优先考虑端到端的改进，为实现PanDA和Rucio系统的协同优化指明了方向，有望提高资源利用率，减少不必要的数据移动，增强整体系统弹性。

Abstract: Large-scale international collaborations such as ATLAS rely on globally
distributed workflows and data management to process, move, and store vast
volumes of data. ATLAS's Production and Distributed Analysis (PanDA) workflow
system and the Rucio data management system are each highly optimized for their
respective design goals. However, operating them together at global scale
exposes systemic inefficiencies, including underutilized resources, redundant
or unnecessary transfers, and altered error distributions. Moreover, PanDA and
Rucio currently lack shared performance awareness and coordinated, adaptive
strategies.
  This work charts a path toward co-optimizing the two systems by diagnosing
data-management pitfalls and prioritizing end-to-end improvements. With the
observation of spatially and temporally imbalanced transfer activities, we
develop a metadata-matching algorithm that links PanDA jobs and Rucio datasets
at the file level, yielding a complete, fine-grained view of data access and
movement. Using this linkage, we identify anomalous transfer patterns that
violate PanDA's data-centric job-allocation principle. We then outline
mitigation strategies for these patterns and highlight opportunities for
tighter PanDA-Rucio coordination to improve resource utilization, reduce
unnecessary data movement, and enhance overall system resilience.

</details>


### [174] [Towards Verifiable Federated Unlearning: Framework, Challenges, and The Road Ahead](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.00833)
*Thanh Linh Nguyen,Marcela Tuler de Oliveira,An Braeken,Aaron Yi Ding,Quoc-Viet Pham*

Main category: cs.DC

TL;DR: 联邦学习中的数据删除（FUL）允许在隐私法规要求下移除分布式模型中的数据影响，但现有方法缺乏可验证性。本文提出了 veriFUL 框架，用于实现可验证的 FUL，包含验证实体、目标、方法和指标，以解决此问题。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 现有的联邦学习数据删除（FUL）方法缺乏可验证性，无法确保用户数据的影响已被彻底移除，这与隐私法规的要求相悖，并阻碍了 FUL 在医疗等高度敏感领域的应用。

Method: 提出 veriFUL，一个形式化的参考框架，定义了验证实体、目标、方法和指标，整合了现有研究并贡献了新概念和指标，以实现可验证的 FUL。

Result: veriFUL 框架为 FUL 提供了可验证的解决方案，有望解决现有 FUL 方法的不足，并为高度监管和数据敏感的服务提供信任基础。

Conclusion: 可验证的 FUL 是 FUL 的关键组成部分，veriFUL 框架为实现这一目标提供了基础，并指明了未来的研究方向和潜在应用。

Abstract: Federated unlearning (FUL) enables removing the data influence from the model
trained across distributed clients, upholding the right to be forgotten as
mandated by privacy regulations. FUL facilitates a value exchange where clients
gain privacy-preserving control over their data contributions, while service
providers leverage decentralized computing and data freshness. However, this
entire proposition is undermined because clients have no reliable way to verify
that their data influence has been provably removed, as current metrics and
simple notifications offer insufficient assurance. We envision unlearning
verification becoming a pivotal and trust-by-design part of the FUL life-cycle
development, essential for highly regulated and data-sensitive services and
applications like healthcare. This article introduces veriFUL, a reference
framework for verifiable FUL that formalizes verification entities, goals,
approaches, and metrics. Specifically, we consolidate existing efforts and
contribute new insights, concepts, and metrics to this domain. Finally, we
highlight research challenges and identify potential applications and
developments for verifiable FUL and veriFUL.

</details>


### [175] [An Efficient, Reliable and Observable Collective Communication Library in Large-scale GPU Training Clusters](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.00991)
*Ziteng Chen,Xiaohe Hu,Menghao Zhang,Yanmin Jia,Yan Zhang,Mingjun Zhang,Da Liu,Fangzheng Jiao,Jun Chen,He Liu,Aohan Zeng,Shuaixing Duan,Ruya Gu,Yang Jing,Bowen Han,Jiahao Cao,Wei Chen,Wenqi Xie,Jinlong Hou,Yuan Cheng,Bohua Xu,Mingwei Xu,Chunming Hu*

Main category: cs.DC

TL;DR: ICCL是一个用于大规模GPU训练集群的高效、可靠、可观测的集体通信库，解决了NCCL在P2P通信效率、RNIC端口故障容忍度和瞬态通信异常可观测性方面的问题。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: NCCL在处理大规模LLM训练时存在P2P通信效率低下、对RNIC端口故障容忍度差以及瞬态集体通信异常可观测性不足等问题。

Method: ICCL将P2P通信从GPU内核卸载到CPU线程以最小化SM消耗，移除不必要的内存拷贝；引入主备QP机制来容忍NIC端口故障；设计了基于窗口的监视器以实现us级网络异常的可观测性。

Result: 与NCCL相比，ICCL在P2P吞吐量/延迟方面分别提高了23.4%/28.5%，训练吞吐量提高了6.02%。

Conclusion: ICCL在生产环境中的部署和测试表明，它在效率、可靠性和可观测性方面优于NCCL，为LLM训练提供了更好的集体通信解决方案。

Abstract: Large-scale LLM training requires collective communication libraries to
exchange data among distributed GPUs. As a company dedicated to building and
operating large-scale GPU training clusters, we encounter several challenges
when using NCCL in production, including 1) limited efficiency with costly and
cumbersome P2P communication, 2) poor tolerance to frequent RNIC port failures,
and 3) insufficient observability of transient collective communication
anomalies. To address these issues, we propose ICCL, an efficient, reliable,
and observable collective communication library in large-scale GPU training
clusters. ICCL offloads the P2P communication from GPU kernels to CPU threads
for minimal SM consumption, and removes the redundant memory copies irrelevant
to the actual communicating process. ICCL also introduces a primary-backup QP
mechanism to tolerate frequent NIC port failures, and designs a window-based
monitor to observe network anomalies at O(us) level. We open-source ICCL and
deploy it in production training clusters for several months, with results
showing that compared to NCCL, ICCL achieves a 23.4%/28.5% improvement in P2P
throughput/latency as well as a 6.02% increase in training throughput. We also
share the operating experience of ICCL in large-scale clusters, hoping to give
the communities more insights on production-level collective communication
libraries in LLM training.

</details>


<div id='cs.AI'></div>

# cs.AI [[Back]](#toc)

### [176] [Learning to Lead Themselves: Agentic AI in MAS using MARL](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.00022)
*Ansh Kamthan*

Main category: cs.AI

TL;DR: 该论文研究了在多智能体系统中，使用去中心化的、合作性的决策方法来提升任务分配和协调的效率，特别是在无人机配送和仓储自动化场景下。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 随着自主系统从原型走向实际应用，多智能体之间的去中心化、合作性决策能力成为核心需求。

Method: 本文在合作式多智能体强化学习的框架下，提出并实现了一种名为IPPO的轻量级多智能体近端策略优化算法，并采用了中心化训练、去中心化执行的范式。

Result: 在PettingZoo环境中进行实验，展示了多个同质无人机或智能体如何在无显式通信的情况下，通过自我组织来完成目标覆盖任务。

Conclusion: IPPO方法能够有效地提升多智能体系统在无通信情况下的任务分配和协调能力，尤其在无人机配送等场景下具有潜力。

Abstract: As autonomous systems move from prototypes to real deployments, the ability
of multiple agents to make decentralized, cooperative decisions becomes a core
requirement. This paper examines how agentic artificial intelligence, agents
that act independently, adaptively and proactively can improve task allocation
and coordination in multi-agent systems, with primary emphasis on drone
delivery and secondary relevance to warehouse automation. We formulate the
problem in a cooperative multi-agent reinforcement learning setting and
implement a lightweight multi-agent Proximal Policy Optimization, called IPPO,
approach in PyTorch under a centralized-training, decentralized-execution
paradigm. Experiments are conducted in PettingZoo environment, where multiple
homogeneous drones or agents must self-organize to cover distinct targets
without explicit communication.

</details>


### [177] [ToolBrain: A Flexible Reinforcement Learning Framework for Agentic Tools](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.00023)
*Quy Minh Le,Minh Sao Khue Luu,Khanh-Tung Tran,Duc-Hai Nguyen,Hoang-Quoc-Viet Pham,Quan Le,Hoang Thanh Lam,Hoang D. Nguyen*

Main category: cs.AI

TL;DR: ToolBrain是一个轻量级的框架，用于在代理AI中训练工具使用，通过灵活的RL和LLM作为裁判来简化奖励设计，并提供知识蒸馏、自动任务生成和高效微调等功能。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 手动设计的奖励、有限的训练数据以及糟糕的多工具选择阻碍了AI代理的工具使用训练，导致适应缓慢、资源浪费和性能不佳。

Method: ToolBrain框架支持多种训练策略（如GRPO、DPO和监督学习），允许直接在执行跟踪上进行自定义奖励调用，或使用LLM作为裁判生成奖励。它还包括知识蒸馏、自动任务生成、工具检索、QLoRA微调和量化推理。

Result: 在代码执行邮件搜索任务的案例研究中，ToolBrain展示了在工具使用技能方面的快速、有针对性的改进（最高可达30.0%），同时保持了代码库的简单性和可扩展性。

Conclusion: ToolBrain是一个用户友好且灵活的框架，可以有效地教练代理AI的工具使用，降低了研究人员和从业人员的门槛，并显著提高了性能。

Abstract: Effective tool use is essential for agentic AI, yet training agents to
utilize tools remains challenging due to manually designed rewards, limited
training data, and poor multi-tool selection, resulting in slow adaptation,
wasted computational resources, and suboptimal performance. We introduce
ToolBrain, a lightweight and user-friendly framework for coaching tool use in
agentic models with flexible reinforcement learning (RL), easing the barriers
for researchers and practitioners to adapt LLM-based agents to specific
domains. It supports a wide range of training strategies, including RL
algorithms such as GRPO and DPO, as well as supervised learning. ToolBrain
enables custom reward callables directly on an agent's execution traces or
simply utilizes an automated LLM-as-a-judge system for reward generation. It is
packed with useful capabilities, including knowledge distillation from large to
small models for efficient development, automatic task generation from tool
descriptions, seamless tool retrieval, efficient fine-tuning pipelines with
QLoRA through Unsloth, and quantized inference via bitsandbytes. We demonstrate
ToolBrain through diverse use cases, such as training a CodeAct agent to
autonomously execute email search tasks, showing fast, targeted improvements
(up to 30.0%) in tool-use skills while keeping the codebase simple and
extensible in Agentic AI. Our framework is publicly available at
https://toolbrain.org.

</details>


### [178] [Semantic Bridges Between First Order c-Representations and Cost-Based Semantics: An Initial Perspective](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.00817)
*Nicholas Leisegang,Giovanni Casini,Thomas Meyer*

Main category: cs.AI

TL;DR: 该论文比较了两种处理不一致知识库的方法：Bienvenu 等人提出的加权知识库和基于成本的语义，以及 Kern-Isberner 提出的 c-表示法（一种非单调推理形式）。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 比较两种处理不一致知识库的方法，并展示它们之间的语义等价性。

Method: 在语义层面比较加权知识库和 c-表示法，重点关注它们如何对解释进行排序以及如何表示蕴含关系。

Result: 在某些条件下，加权知识库和一组可疑条件可以生成相同的解释排序，表明在相对成本上存在语义结构等价性。此外，两种形式主义都可以等效地表达某些概念。

Conclusion: 研究结果表明，加权知识库和 c-表示法在语义上是等价的，并且可以相互转化，这有助于未来在成本基础语义和 c-表示法方面的研究。

Abstract: Weighted-knowledge bases and cost-based semantics represent a recent
formalism introduced by Bienvenu et al. for Ontology Mediated Data Querying in
the case where a given knowledge base is inconsistent. This is done by adding a
weight to each statement in the knowledge base (KB), and then giving each DL
interpretation a cost based on how often it breaks rules in the KB. In this
paper we compare this approach with c-representations, a form of non-monotonic
reasoning originally introduced by Kern-Isberner. c-Representations describe a
means to interpret defeasible concept inclusions in the first-order case. This
is done by assigning a numerical ranking to each interpretations via penalties
for each violated conditional. We compare these two approaches on a semantic
level. In particular, we show that under certain conditions a weighted
knowledge base and a set of defeasible conditionals can generate the same
ordering on interpretations, and therefore an equivalence of semantic
structures up to relative cost. Moreover, we compare entailment described in
both cases, where certain notions are equivalently expressible in both
formalisms. Our results have the potential to benefit further work on both
cost-based semantics and c-representations

</details>


### [179] [ARS: Adaptive Reasoning Suppression for Efficient Large Reasoning Language Models](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.00071)
*Dongqi Zheng*

Main category: cs.AI

TL;DR: 该研究提出了一种名为自适应推理抑制（ARS）的训练无关方法，通过动态抑制冗余推理步骤来提高大型推理语言模型（LRM）的效率，同时保持准确性。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 大型推理语言模型（LRM）在复杂推理任务中表现出色，但由于过度思考，计算效率低下。现有的高效推理方法难以平衡推理质量和推理成本的降低。

Method: ARS 引入了一种多检查点确定性估计机制，并带有渐进式抑制阈值，以动态监控确定性并抑制冗余推理步骤。

Result: 在数学推理基准测试和多种模型架构上的广泛评估表明，ARS 在代币、延迟和能源消耗方面实现了高达 53%、46.1% 和 57.9% 的降低，同时保持或提高了准确性。

Conclusion: ARS 是一种有效的训练无关方法，可以显著提高 LRM 的推理效率，同时保持其准确性，优于静态抑制方法。

Abstract: Large Reasoning Language Models (LRLMs or LRMs) demonstrate remarkable
capabilities in complex reasoning tasks, but suffer from significant
computational inefficiencies due to overthinking phenomena. Existing efficient
reasoning methods face the challenge of balancing reasoning quality with
inference cost reduction. We propose \textbf{Adaptive Reasoning Suppression
(ARS)}, a novel training-free approach that dynamically suppresses redundant
reasoning steps while preserving accuracy through adaptive certainty
monitoring. ARS introduces a multi-checkpoint certainty estimation mechanism
with progressive suppression thresholds, achieving superior efficiency compared
to static suppression methods. Our extensive evaluation across mathematical
reasoning benchmarks using multiple model architectures demonstrates that ARS
achieves up to 53%, 46.1%, and 57.9% in token, latency and energy reduction,
while maintaining or improving accuracy.

</details>


### [180] [NeurIPS should lead scientific consensus on AI policy](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.00075)
*Rishi Bommasani*

Main category: cs.AI

TL;DR:  to ensure wise AI policy development, NeurIPS should actively foster scientific consensus, drawing lessons from the IPCC's success in climate policy, despite potential objections about AI researcher disagreement and NeurIPS's role.


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: Policymakers need rigorous evidence and scientific consensus for effective AI policy, but current mechanisms for consensus formation are lacking.

Method: This paper argues that NeurIPS should take a leading role in catalyzing scientific consensus on AI policy, proposes piloting this by learning from the IPCC's methods, and addresses counterarguments.

Result: Identifies a void in consensus formation mechanisms for AI policy and proposes NeurIPS as the ideal venue to address this gap.

Conclusion: NeurIPS, being a leader in AI, should champion scientific consensus to improve the quality of AI policy, overcoming challenges related to researcher disagreement and its perceived role.

Abstract: Designing wise AI policy is a grand challenge for society. To design such
policy, policymakers should place a premium on rigorous evidence and scientific
consensus. While several mechanisms exist for evidence generation, and nascent
mechanisms tackle evidence synthesis, we identify a complete void on consensus
formation. In this position paper, we argue NeurIPS should actively catalyze
scientific consensus on AI policy. Beyond identifying the current deficit in
consensus formation mechanisms, we argue that NeurIPS is the best option due
its strengths and the paucity of compelling alternatives. To make progress, we
recommend initial pilots for NeurIPS by distilling lessons from the IPCC's
leadership to build scientific consensus on climate policy. We dispel
predictable counters that AI researchers disagree too much to achieve consensus
and that policy engagement is not the business of NeurIPS. NeurIPS leads AI on
many fronts, and it should champion scientific consensus to create higher
quality AI policy.

</details>


### [181] [A Neuro-Fuzzy System for Interpretable Long-Term Stock Market Forecasting](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.00960)
*Miha Ožbot,Igor Škrjanc,Vitomir Štruc*

Main category: cs.AI

TL;DR: Fuzzformer是一种结合了LSTM、多头自注意力机制和模糊推理系统的新型循环神经网络模型，用于多元时间序列预测，在预测精度和可解释性方面表现出色，并在S&P500股票市场数据上进行了验证。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 在多元时间序列预测领域，同时实现预测精度和可解释性仍然是一个重大挑战。

Method: 该模型结合了LSTM网络、时间注意力机制、多头自注意力和模糊推理系统，将多元数据转化为适用于模糊推理系统的可解释特征。

Result: Fuzzformer在预测性能上与ARIMA和LSTM等传统模型相当，并提供了有意义的网络内部信息流。在S&P500股票市场指数上的初步结果显示出可解释预测的潜力。

Conclusion: Fuzzformer在可解释性方面具有优势，在预测精度上与传统模型相当，并能在理解和预测股票市场行为方面具有实际应用潜力。

Abstract: In the complex landscape of multivariate time series forecasting, achieving
both accuracy and interpretability remains a significant challenge. This paper
introduces the Fuzzy Transformer (Fuzzformer), a novel recurrent neural network
architecture combined with multi-head self-attention and fuzzy inference
systems to analyze multivariate stock market data and conduct long-term time
series forecasting. The method leverages LSTM networks and temporal attention
to condense multivariate data into interpretable features suitable for fuzzy
inference systems. The resulting architecture offers comparable forecasting
performance to conventional models such as ARIMA and LSTM while providing
meaningful information flow within the network. The method was examined on the
real world stock market index S\&P500. Initial results show potential for
interpretable forecasting and identify current performance tradeoffs,
suggesting practical application in understanding and forecasting stock market
behavior.

</details>


### [182] [Towards a Framework for Supporting the Ethical and Regulatory Certification of AI Systems](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.00084)
*Fabian Kovac,Sebastian Neumaier,Timea Pahi,Torsten Priebe,Rafael Rodrigues,Dimitrios Christodoulou,Maxime Cordy,Sylvain Kubler,Ali Kordia,Georgios Pitsiladis,John Soldatos,Petros Zervoudakis*

Main category: cs.AI

TL;DR: CERTAIN项目提出一个集成监管合规、伦理标准和透明度的AI框架，通过语义MLOps、本体驱动的数据溯源和RegOps工作流解决AI带来的伦理、法律和监管挑战，旨在促进符合欧洲标准的负责任的AI创新。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: AI的快速发展带来了严峻的伦理、法律和监管挑战，需要一个综合性框架来解决这些问题。

Method: 该项目提出一个包含三个核心组成部分的方法论：1. 语义MLOps：用于结构化的AI生命周期管理。2. 本体驱动的数据溯源：确保可追溯性和问责制。3. RegOps工作流：用于操作化合规要求。

Result: 通过在不同试点项目中实施和验证解决方案，CERTAIN旨在推进监管合规，并促进符合欧洲标准的负责任的AI创新。

Conclusion: CERTAIN项目通过提出的框架和方法，旨在解决AI带来的伦理、法律和监管挑战，并推动负责任的AI创新。

Abstract: Artificial Intelligence has rapidly become a cornerstone technology,
significantly influencing Europe's societal and economic landscapes. However,
the proliferation of AI also raises critical ethical, legal, and regulatory
challenges. The CERTAIN (Certification for Ethical and Regulatory Transparency
in Artificial Intelligence) project addresses these issues by developing a
comprehensive framework that integrates regulatory compliance, ethical
standards, and transparency into AI systems. In this position paper, we outline
the methodological steps for building the core components of this framework.
Specifically, we present: (i) semantic Machine Learning Operations (MLOps) for
structured AI lifecycle management, (ii) ontology-driven data lineage tracking
to ensure traceability and accountability, and (iii) regulatory operations
(RegOps) workflows to operationalize compliance requirements. By implementing
and validating its solutions across diverse pilots, CERTAIN aims to advance
regulatory compliance and to promote responsible AI innovation aligned with
European standards.

</details>


### [183] [Judging by Appearances? Auditing and Intervening Vision-Language Models for Bail Prediction](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.00088)
*Sagnik Basu,Shubham Prakash,Ashish Maruti Barge,Siddharth D Jaiswal,Abhisek Dash,Saptarshi Ghosh,Animesh Mukherjee*

Main category: cs.AI

TL;DR: 视觉语言模型(VLM)在仅使用图像进行保释决定预测时表现不佳，并且在交叉群体中存在偏见。通过结合法律先例和微调，可以显著提高模型性能。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 虽然大型语言模型(LLM)已被用于法律判决预测，但大型视觉语言模型(VLM)的出现使得利用罪犯图像成为可能，这可能带来意想不到的后果或恶意使用。因此，有必要审计独立 VLM 在保释决定预测任务中的效率。

Method: 首先，审计独立 VLM 在保释决定预测任务中的效率，并观察其在多个交叉群体中的表现。然后，设计干预算法，包括通过检索增强生成(RAG)管道纳入法律先例，并采用创新的方案对 VLM 进行微调。

Result: 审计结果显示，独立 VLM 在保释决定预测任务上的表现不佳，并在多个交叉群体中存在偏见，会自信地错误拒绝合格个人的保释。干预算法显著提高了保释预测的性能。

Conclusion: 这项工作为未来在 VLM 部署到现实世界的法律判决预测任务之前，设计更智能的干预措施铺平了道路。

Abstract: Large language models (LLMs) have been extensively used for legal judgment
prediction tasks based on case reports and crime history. However, with a surge
in the availability of large vision language models (VLMs), legal judgment
prediction systems can now be made to leverage the images of the criminals in
addition to the textual case reports/crime history. Applications built in this
way could lead to inadvertent consequences and be used with malicious intent.
In this work, we run an audit to investigate the efficiency of standalone VLMs
in the bail decision prediction task. We observe that the performance is poor
across multiple intersectional groups and models \textit{wrongly deny bail to
deserving individuals with very high confidence}. We design different
intervention algorithms by first including legal precedents through a RAG
pipeline and then fine-tuning the VLMs using innovative schemes. We demonstrate
that these interventions substantially improve the performance of bail
prediction. Our work paves the way for the design of smarter interventions on
VLMs in the future, before they can be deployed for real-world legal judgment
prediction.

</details>


### [184] [AuditAgent: Expert-Guided Multi-Agent Reasoning for Cross-Document Fraudulent Evidence Discovery](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.00156)
*Songran Bai,Bingzhe Wu,Yiwei Zhang,Chengke Wu,Xiaolong Zheng,Yaze Yuan,Ke Wu,Jianqiang Li*

Main category: cs.AI

TL;DR: AuditAgent是一个利用审计领域专业知识的多智能体推理框架，用于金融欺诈案件的细粒度证据链定位，通过整合风险先验、混合检索策略和专业智能体模块，能够有效地识别和聚合跨报告的证据，并在召回率和可解释性方面显著优于通用智能体范式。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 金融欺诈在现实场景中由于证据分散在复杂的多年财务披露中而难以检测。

Method: 提出了一种名为AuditAgent的新型多智能体推理框架，该框架结合了审计领域的专业知识，用于金融欺诈案件的细粒度证据链定位。利用从中国证券监督管理委员会发布的监管文件和财务报告构建的专家注释数据集，该方法整合了主体级别的风险先验、混合检索策略和专门的智能体模块，以有效地识别和聚合跨报告的证据。

Result: 通过大量实验证明，该方法在召回率和可解释性方面均显著优于通用智能体范式，为自动化、透明的金融取证树立了新的标杆。

Conclusion: 研究结果强调了领域特定推理和数据集构建在推进实际、真实世界监管应用中稳健的金融欺诈检测方面的价值。

Abstract: Financial fraud detection in real-world scenarios presents significant
challenges due to the subtlety and dispersion of evidence across complex,
multi-year financial disclosures. In this work, we introduce a novel
multi-agent reasoning framework AuditAgent, enhanced with auditing domain
expertise, for fine-grained evidence chain localization in financial fraud
cases. Leveraging an expert-annotated dataset constructed from enforcement
documents and financial reports released by the China Securities Regulatory
Commission, our approach integrates subject-level risk priors, a hybrid
retrieval strategy, and specialized agent modules to efficiently identify and
aggregate cross-report evidence. Extensive experiments demonstrate that our
method substantially outperforms General-Purpose Agent paradigm in both recall
and interpretability, establishing a new benchmark for automated, transparent
financial forensics. Our results highlight the value of domain-specific
reasoning and dataset construction for advancing robust financial fraud
detection in practical, real-world regulatory applications.

</details>


### [185] [Drones that Think on their Feet: Sudden Landing Decisions with Embodied AI](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.00167)
*Diego Ortiz Barbosa,Mohit Agrawal,Yash Malegaonkar,Luis Burbano,Axel Andersson,György Dán,Henrik Sandberg,Alvaro A. Cardenas*

Main category: cs.AI

TL;DR: 利用大型视觉语言模型实现自主无人机的实时适应性决策，以应对突发事件。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 传统方法依赖人工编码的恢复规则，无法应对现实世界中的各种意外情况，且容易过时。需要一种更具适应性的方法来提高自主空中系统的弹性和安全性。

Method: 在模拟的城市环境中，利用大型视觉语言模型（embodied AI）使无人机能够动态解释周围环境，并为安全着陆做出紧急机动决策。

Result: 与传统方法相比，基于实体AI的方法能够实现先前手动设计无法实现的适应性恢复和决策流程，显著提高了无人机的安全性和可靠性。

Conclusion: 实体AI为自主空中系统带来了新的适应性恢复和决策能力，解决了传统方法在应对突发事件方面的局限性，提高了系统的弹性和安全性。

Abstract: Autonomous drones must often respond to sudden events, such as alarms,
faults, or unexpected changes in their environment, that require immediate and
adaptive decision-making. Traditional approaches rely on safety engineers
hand-coding large sets of recovery rules, but this strategy cannot anticipate
the vast range of real-world contingencies and quickly becomes incomplete.
Recent advances in embodied AI, powered by large visual language models,
provide commonsense reasoning to assess context and generate appropriate
actions in real time. We demonstrate this capability in a simulated urban
benchmark in the Unreal Engine, where drones dynamically interpret their
surroundings and decide on sudden maneuvers for safe landings. Our results show
that embodied AI makes possible a new class of adaptive recovery and
decision-making pipelines that were previously infeasible to design by hand,
advancing resilience and safety in autonomous aerial systems.

</details>


### [186] [Object-Centric Case-Based Reasoning via Argumentation](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.00185)
*Gabriel de Olim Gaul,Adam Gould,Avinash Kori,Francesca Toni*

Main category: cs.AI

TL;DR: SAA-CBR是一种结合了对象中心学习和符号推理的神经符号流水线，用于图像分类，并在CLEVR-Hans数据集上表现出竞争力。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 本研究旨在提出一种新的神经符号流水线SAA-CBR，用于图像分类，该流水线整合了通过神经槽注意力（SA）组件实现的对象中心学习和通过抽象论证案例推理（AA-CBR）进行的符号推理。

Method: SAA-CBR流水线整合了AA-CBR与神经组件，包括特征组合策略、通过代表性样本进行的案例库缩减、新的基于计数的偏序、用于将AA-CBR扩展到多类分类的Rest策略，以及应用支持AA-CBR（AA-CBR的双极变体）。

Result: SAA-CBR在CLEVR-Hans数据集上被证明是一种有效的分类器，其性能可与基线模型相媲美。

Conclusion: SAA-CBR作为一种图像分类器是有效的，并且展现出与现有模型相当的性能。

Abstract: We introduce Slot Attention Argumentation for Case-Based Reasoning (SAA-CBR),
a novel neuro-symbolic pipeline for image classification that integrates
object-centric learning via a neural Slot Attention (SA) component with
symbolic reasoning conducted by Abstract Argumentation for Case-Based Reasoning
(AA-CBR). We explore novel integrations of AA-CBR with the neural component,
including feature combination strategies, casebase reduction via representative
samples, novel count-based partial orders, a One-Vs-Rest strategy for extending
AA-CBR to multi-class classification, and an application of Supported AA-CBR, a
bipolar variant of AA-CBR. We demonstrate that SAA-CBR is an effective
classifier on the CLEVR-Hans datasets, showing competitive performance against
baseline models.

</details>


### [187] [MAGIC-MASK: Multi-Agent Guided Inter-Agent Collaboration with Mask-Based Explainability for Reinforcement Learning](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.00274)
*Maisha Maliha,Dean Hougen*

Main category: cs.AI

TL;DR: 本研究提出了MAGIC-MASK，一个用于多智能体强化学习的可解释性框架，通过引入跨智能体协作和基于遮蔽的状态信息共享，克服了现有方法的局限性，提高了学习效率和模型鲁棒性。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 为了解决深度强化学习（DRL）在安全关键和多智能体环境中的部署挑战，以及现有可解释性方法（如StateMask）在计算成本、探索覆盖率和对多智能体设置的适应性方面的局限性。

Method: MAGIC-MASK框架整合了近端策略优化（PPO）、自适应epsilon-greedy探索以及轻量级的跨智能体协作，允许智能体共享遮蔽状态信息和同伴经验，从而进行显著性引导的遮蔽，并分享基于奖励的见解。其核心创新在于通过轨迹扰动、奖励保真度分析和KL散度正则化的统一数学形式，将可解释性从单智能体推广到多智能体系统。

Result: 实验结果表明，MAGIC-MASK在单智能体和多智能体基准测试（包括多智能体高速公路驾驶环境和Google Research Football）上，在可解释性、学习效率和策略鲁棒性方面持续优于最先进的基线方法，并能提供可解释和可迁移的解释。

Conclusion: MAGIC-MASK成功地将可解释性从单智能体扩展到多智能体强化学习系统，通过创新的协作机制和数学框架，显著提高了学习效率、模型鲁棒性和解释的保真度，为在复杂环境中部署DRL系统提供了有力的支持。

Abstract: Understanding the decision-making process of Deep Reinforcement Learning
agents remains a key challenge for deploying these systems in safety-critical
and multi-agent environments. While prior explainability methods like
StateMask, have advanced the identification of critical states, they remain
limited by computational cost, exploration coverage, and lack of adaptation to
multi-agent settings. To overcome these limitations, we propose a
mathematically grounded framework, MAGIC-MASK (Multi-Agent Guided Inter-agent
Collaboration with Mask-Based Explainability for Reinforcement Learning), that
extends perturbation-based explanation to Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning.
Our method integrates Proximal Policy Optimization, adaptive epsilon-greedy
exploration, and lightweight inter-agent collaboration to share masked state
information and peer experience. This collaboration enables each agent to
perform saliency-guided masking and share reward-based insights with peers,
reducing the time required for critical state discovery, improving explanation
fidelity, and leading to faster and more robust learning. The core novelty of
our approach lies in generalizing explainability from single-agent to
multi-agent systems through a unified mathematical formalism built on
trajectory perturbation, reward fidelity analysis, and Kullback-Leibler
divergence regularization. This framework yields localized, interpretable
explanations grounded in probabilistic modeling and multi-agent Markov decision
processes. We validate our framework on both single-agent and multi-agent
benchmarks, including a multi-agent highway driving environment and Google
Research Football, demonstrating that MAGIC-MASK consistently outperforms
state-of-the-art baselines in fidelity, learning efficiency, and policy
robustness while offering interpretable and transferable explanations.

</details>


### [188] [Thinkquel: A Model Dedicated to Text-to-dbt Using Synthetic Data and a Span-Aware Objective](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.00186)
*Anni Li,Aria Attar,Paul Dong*

Main category: cs.AI

TL;DR: Thinkquel是一个用于生成可靠、可移植、经过执行验证的数据库查询的微调模型，它通过新颖的合成数据管道TS-SQL和跨越token级别训练信号与序列级别执行奖励的TS-GRPO来实现。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 将自然语言请求转换为可靠、可生产的数据转换仍然具有挑战性，因为正确性取决于精确的模式链接和特定于数据仓库的SQL方言，而训练期间可用的最强监督——执行成功和结果匹配——仅在序列级别提供。同时，组装大型、经过执行验证的语料库成本高昂，并且token级别的目标与这些全局信号不一致，导致优化不稳定和可移植性有限。

Method: Thinkquel的 metodologias 集成了一个新颖的合成数据管道TS-SQL，它利用dbt作为可移植的中间表示，并采用面向跨度的强化学习目标，以及Token-Sequence GRPO（TS-GRPO），该目标专门设计用于在微调LLM时弥合token级别训练信号和序列级别执行奖励之间的差距。

Result: 在500个示例的TS-SQL测试集上，Thinkquel（32B）通过两阶段SFT课程达到了93.2%的执行成功率和61.8%的确切结果匹配率，在执行成功率方面比基础模型提高了67.2%，在结果匹配率方面提高了44.4%。在Spider（14B）实验中，与GRPO和GSPO相比，TS-GRPO提高了训练稳定性并加快了执行匹配奖励的收敛速度。

Conclusion: Thinkquel通过结合TS-SQL合成数据管道和TS-GRPO训练方法，有效地解决了将自然语言转换为SQL查询的挑战，显著提高了查询的准确性、鲁棒性和可移植性。

Abstract: Transforming natural-language requests into reliable, production-ready data
transformations remains challenging: correctness depends on precise schema
linking and warehouse-specific SQL dialects, while the strongest supervision
available during training--execution success and result matching--are provided
only at the sequence level. At the same time, assembling large,
execution-validated corpora is costly, and token-level objectives misalign with
these global signals, yielding unstable optimization and limited portability.
We introduce Thinkquel, a fine-tuned model for producing robust, portable, and
execution-validated database queries. Methodologies in Thinkquel integrates a
novel synthetic data pipeline, TS-SQL, that leverages dbt as a portable
intermediate representation with a span-aware reinforcement learning objective,
and Token-Sequence GRPO (TS-GRPO), specifically designed to bridge the gap
between token-level training signals and sequence-level execution rewards when
finetuning LLMs. On the 500-example TS-SQL test set, Thinkquel (32B) reaches
93.2\% execution success and 61.8\% exact-result match with a two-stage SFT
curriculum, improving over the base model by 67.2\% (exec.) and 44.4\% (match).
In Spider (14B) experiments, TS-GRPO increases training stability and speeds
convergence of the execution-match reward relative to GRPO and GSPO.

</details>


### [189] [DualTune: Decoupled Fine-Tuning for On-Device Agentic Systems](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.00229)
*Rohan Kadekodi,Zhan Jin,Keisuke Kamahori,Yile Gu,Sean Khatiri,Noah H. Bayindirli,Sergey Gorbunov,Baris Kasikci*

Main category: cs.AI

TL;DR: 本地LLM在工具调用方面表现不佳，我们提出了一种解耦微调方法和DualTune框架，通过将工具调用分解为工具选择和参数生成两个子任务，并使用LoRA适配器分别进行微调，显著提高了本地LLM在工具调用任务上的准确性。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 为了在保护隐私和降低成本的前提下，实现LLM在终端设备上的本地推理能力，解决本地LLM在工具选择和参数生成方面能力不足的问题。

Method: 提出“解耦微调”方法，将工具调用任务分解为工具选择和参数生成两个子任务，并使用LoRA进行微调，为每个子任务创建独立的LoRA适配器。提出DualTune推理框架，动态加载适配器以实现高效的代理编排，并引入分层编排以减少工具选择所需的工具数量。

Result: 在MCP-Bench基准测试中，使用解耦微调训练的Qwen-2.5-7B模型，在工具调用准确性方面比基础模型提高了46%，并且在大多数情况下优于其他同等大小的本地模型（包括推理和非推理模型以及微调模型），在某些情况下也优于两倍大小的模型。

Conclusion: 解耦微调和DualTune框架能够有效提升本地LLM在工具调用任务上的性能，为实现低成本、高效率、隐私保护的端侧智能代理提供了可行方案。

Abstract: The deployment of Large Language Models (LLMs) as agentic orchestrators has
revolutionized task automation, but the need for privacy-preserving,
cost-effective solutions demands on-device inference capabilities. However,
local LLMs consistently underperform compared to frontier models in tool
calling scenarios, struggling with both tool selection from large tool sets and
accurate argument generation for complex parameter structures. We introduce a
methodology that disaggregates a tool-calling task into two distinct subtasks:
tool selection and argument generation. We propose "decoupled fine-tuning", a
novel post-training approach that employs LoRA fine-tuning to create dedicated
LoRA adapters for tool selection and tool-specific argument generation using
separate loss masking for each of the subtasks. Furthermore, we present
DualTune, an inference framework that leverages the LoRA adapters created using
decoupled fine-tuning to perform efficient agent orchestration with the help of
local models on end-user devices. DualTune decomposes the tool-call generation
step into tool selection and argument generation, and dynamically loads the
corresponding LoRA adapters to generate tool calls. Additionally, DualTune
implements hierarchical orchestration to restrict the number of tools required
for tool selection. Our experiments on the MCP-Bench benchmark demonstrate that
the Qwen-2.5-7B model trained using decoupled fine-tuning improves the tool
calling accuracy of the base model by 46%, and outperforms other local
reasoning, non-reasoning and fine-tuned models of similar size in all cases,
and models that are 2x larger, in most cases.

</details>


### [190] [ICL Optimized Fragility](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.00300)
*Serena Gomez Wannaz*

Main category: cs.AI

TL;DR: ICL指南在提高特定任务性能方面有显著作用，但其对跨领域认知能力的影响尚不明确。本研究探讨了ICL指南如何通过六种GPT-OSS:20b模型变体（一种基线模型和五种ICL配置）来影响不同知识领域的推理能力。实验结果表明，ICL模型在一般知识任务上表现出高准确率（91%-99%），但在复杂推理问题上表现下降，准确率降至10%-43%，这是一种被称为“优化脆弱性”的现象。然而，在复杂的数学奥林匹克问题上，ICL模型与基线模型相比没有显著差异，表明ICL优化并未影响复杂的数学推理能力。研究得出结论，ICL指南在模型效率和推理灵活性之间存在系统性的权衡，这对大型语言模型的部署和人工智能安全具有重要意义。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 研究ICL（In-Context Learning）指南对跨领域认知能力的影响，特别是其对不同知识领域推理能力的作用，以填补现有研究空白。

Method: 使用六种GPT-OSS:20b模型变体（一种基线模型和五种ICL配置：简单、思维链、随机、附加文本和符号语言）进行实验，并在包含一般知识问题、逻辑谜题和数学奥林匹克问题在内的840个测试中评估模型性能。采用方差分析（ANOVA）进行统计分析。

Result: ICL模型在一般知识任务上达到了91%-99%的准确率，但在复杂推理问题（如逻辑谜题）上表现下降，准确率降至10%-43%，而基线模型的准确率为43%。在数学奥林匹克问题上，不同模型间的准确率差异不显著（p=0.2173）。ANOVA分析显示，ICL变体在行为上存在显著差异（p<0.001）。

Conclusion: ICL指南在提高模型特定任务效率的同时，可能导致推理灵活性下降，即“优化脆弱性”。这种现象在一般知识任务上表现明显，但在复杂的数学推理任务上影响不大。ICL指南在效率和灵活性之间存在系统性权衡，这对大型语言模型的部署和AI安全至关重要。

Abstract: ICL guides are known to improve task-specific performance, but their impact
on cross-domain cognitive abilities remains unexplored. This study examines how
ICL guides affect reasoning across different knowledge domains using six
variants of the GPT-OSS:20b model: one baseline model and five ICL
configurations (simple, chain-of-thought, random, appended text, and symbolic
language). The models were subjected to 840 tests spanning general knowledge
questions, logic riddles, and a mathematical olympiad problem. Statistical
analysis (ANOVA) revealed significant behavioral modifications (p less than
0.001) across ICL variants, demonstrating a phenomenon termed "optimized
fragility." ICL models achieved 91%-99% accuracy on general knowledge tasks
while showing degraded performance on complex reasoning problems, with accuracy
dropping to 10-43% on riddles compared to 43% for the baseline model. Notably,
no significant differences emerged on the olympiad problem (p=0.2173),
suggesting that complex mathematical reasoning remains unaffected by ICL
optimization. These findings indicate that ICL guides create systematic
trade-offs between efficiency and reasoning flexibility, with important
implications for LLM deployment and AI safety.

</details>


### [191] [BiasBusters: Uncovering and Mitigating Tool Selection Bias in Large Language Models](https://arxiv.org/abs/2510.00307)
*Thierry Blankenstein,Jialin Yu,Zixuan Li,Vassilis Plachouras,Sunando Sengupta,Philip Torr,Yarin Gal,Alasdair Paren,Adel Bibi*

Main category: cs.AI

TL;DR: LLM驱动的代理商在选择工具时存在偏见，偏好特定提供商或靠前排名的工具。


<details>
  <summary>Details</summary>
Motivation: 评估和解决LLM代理商在选择外部工具时可能存在的公平性问题，这种不公平可能导致用户体验下降和市场竞争扭曲。

Method: 引入一个包含多种功能相似工具的基准来评估工具选择偏见。测试了七种模型，并通过控制实验检查工具特征、元数据（名称、描述、参数）和预训练数据的影响。最后提出了一种通过筛选和均匀采样来减轻偏见的轻量级方法。

Result: 发现语义与元数据的匹配度是选择的最强预测因子；修改描述会显著改变选择；重复预训练暴露于单一端点会放大偏见。所提出的缓解方法可以减少偏见并保持良好的任务覆盖率。

Conclusion: 工具选择偏见是工具增强型LLM公平部署的一个关键障碍。

Abstract: Agents backed by large language models (LLMs) often rely on external tools
drawn from marketplaces where multiple providers offer functionally equivalent
options. This raises a critical point concerning fairness: if selection is
systematically biased, it can degrade user experience and distort competition
by privileging some providers over others. We introduce a benchmark of diverse
tool categories, each containing multiple functionally equivalent tools, to
evaluate tool-selection bias. Using this benchmark, we test seven models and
show that unfairness exists with models either fixating on a single provider or
disproportionately preferring earlier-listed tools in context. To investigate
the origins of this bias, we conduct controlled experiments examining tool
features, metadata (name, description, parameters), and pre-training exposure.
We find that: (1) semantic alignment between queries and metadata is the
